name: Avoid PLI Programs with more than XX lines of code (PL1)
description:
This rule searches for PL1 Main Procedures (Programs) with more than X Lines of Code.
The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
The report lists all the PL1 Main Procedures having more than xxx lines of code.

It provides following information: 
- PLI program full name
rationale: Artifacts with more than XX lines of code are generally difficult to maintain.
remediation: Split the PLI Programs in order to not have more than XXX of code.
alternativeName: Avoid PLI Programs with more than XX lines of code (PL1)

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
